titles: CONFIRMATION OF AGENDA
details: That the Agenda for the 2022 July 7 Regular Meeting of the Infrastructure and Planning Committee be confirmed.

titles: CONSENT AGENDA
details: That the Consent Agenda be approved as follows:

titles: Deferral Request – North Hill Communities Heritage Guidelines due Q3 2022 to Q4 2022, IP2022-0806
attachment_names: North Hill Communities Heritage Guidelines - IP2022-0806.pdf

titles: Expanded Active and Safe Routes to School Program, IP2022-0556
Expanded Active and Safe Routes to School Program, IP2022-0556
Expanded Active and Safe Routes to School Program, IP2022-0556
details:
That Recommendation #2 contained in Report IP2022-0556 be amended by deleting Recommendation 2 in its entirety and replacing with the following new 2a:
2. Direct Administration to:
a. Include the Active and Safe Routes to School program in the 2023-2026 budget in an amount that replicates the funding from the existing program of $1.5 million in capital over the four-year program and $75k in annual operating in order to support sustainable, safe, comfortable, and accessible school travel; and

That Recommendation #2 contained in Report IP2022-0556 be amended by deleting Recommendation 2 in its entirety and replacing with the following new 2b:
2. Direct Administration to: 
b. Bring an option in the 2023-2026 budget for an expanded package that would accelerate the programs objectives for Council’s consideration.

That with respect to Report IP2022-0556, the following be approved, as amended:
That the Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommend that Council:

Receive this Report for information; and
Direct Administration to:




Include the Active and Safe Routes to School program in the 2023-2026 budget in an amount that replicates the funding from the existing program of $1.5 million in capital over the four-year program and $75k in annual operating in order to support sustainable, safe, comfortable, and accessible school travel; and
Bring an option in the 2023-2026 budget for an expanded package that would accelerate the programs objectives for Council’s consideration.
votes: Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Sharp, Councillor Spencer, Councillor McLean, Councillor Mian, Councillor Penner, Councillor Chabot, Councillor Wong
Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Sharp, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Mian, Councillor Penner, Councillor Wong
Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Sharp, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Mian, Councillor Wong

titles: Calgary Transit Fare and Revenue Strategy, IP2022-0803
Calgary Transit Fare and Revenue Strategy, IP2022-0803
Calgary Transit Fare and Revenue Strategy, IP2022-0803
Calgary Transit Fare and Revenue Strategy, IP2022-0803
Calgary Transit Fare and Revenue Strategy, IP2022-0803
Calgary Transit Fare and Revenue Strategy, IP2022-0803
details: By General Consent, pursuant to Section 6(1) of Procedure Bylaw 35M2017, Committee suspended Section 78(2)(a) of the Procedure Bylaw to forego the lunch recess.
By General Consent, Committee recessed to the Call of the Chair and to reconvene in the Engineering Traditions Committee Room.
That Recommendation #1 contained in Report IP2022-0803 be amended by deleting the word "determine" following the words "Attachment 2 to" and replacing with the word "recommend".
That Recommendation #2 contained in Report IP2022-0803  be amended by adding the words "non-fare" following the words "revenues from existing".

That the Recommendations contained in Report IP2022-0803 be amended by adding a new Recommendation #3, as follows:
3. Return to Community Development Committee upon completion of the Route Ahead Update, with any adjustments to the fare strategy that are warranted under the updated strategy.

That with respect to Report IP2022-0803, the following be approved, as amended:
That the Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommend that Council direct Administration to:

Use the guiding principles outlined in Attachment 2 to recommend fares/user fees and estimate revenues for the 2023-2026 Service Plans; and
Increase revenues from existing sources and continue to explore new revenue sources.
votes: Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Sharp, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Penner, Councillor Chabot
Councillor Carra, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Penner
Councillor DhaliwalAgainst: (4)Councillor Demong, Councillor Sharp, Councillor Mian

details:
That with respect to Report IP2022-0811, the following be approved: 
That the Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommend that Council:


Authorize the Recommendations as outlined in Attachment 1;
Authorize the Reserve Bids for properties in the 2022 Tax Sale as outlined in Attachment 2; and
Authorize the Coordinator, Real Estate Acquisitions of Real Estate & Development Services to bid on parcels at the 2022 Tax Sale.
votes: Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Sharp, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Mian

titles: CONFIDENTIAL ITEMS
CONFIDENTIAL ITEMS
details:
That pursuant to Sections 23 (Local public body confidences), 24 (Advice from officials) and 25 (Disclosure harmful to economic and other interests of a public body) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, Committee now move into Closed Meeting at 1:12 p.m., in the Engineering Traditions Committee Room, to discuss confidential matters with respect to the following Items:


10.1.1 Proposed Method of Disposition - Various Properties (11211, 11235 52 ST SE; 8450 112 AV NW), IP2022-0809; 


10.1.2 Proposed Transfer of Environmental Reserve - Ward 09 (1325 Deerfoot TR SE), IP2022-0808; and


10.1.3 Proposed Land Exchange (Inglewood) – Ward 09 (4, 6, 16 New ST SE), IP2022-0812.
That Committee rise and report.

titles: Proposed Method of Disposition - Various Properties (11211, 11235 52 ST SE; 8450 112 AV NW), IP2022-0809
details:
That with respect to Confidential Report IP2022-0809, the following be approved:
That the Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommend that Council: 


Authorize the Recommendations as outlined in Attachment 3;
Direct that the Recommendations, Report and Attachments 1, 2, 3, and 4 remain confidential pursuant to Sections 23 (Local public body confidences), 24 (Advice from officials), and 25 (Disclosure harmful to economic and other interests of a public body) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act until the sale has closed; and 
Direct that Attachments 5 and 6 remain confidential pursuant Sections 23 (Local public body confidences), 24 (Advice from officials), and 25 (Disclosure harmful to economic and other interests of a public body) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, to be reviewed by 2031 June 30.
votes: Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Mian

summary.summary_text: The Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommends that Council: Authorize the Recommendations, Report and Attachments 1, 2, 3,

titles: Proposed Transfer of Environmental Reserve - Ward 09 (1325 Deerfoot TR SE), IP2022-0808
Proposed Transfer of Environmental Reserve - Ward 09 (1325 Deerfoot TR SE), IP2022-0808
details:
That with respect to Confidential Report IP2022-0808, the following be approved:
That the Infrastructure and Planning Committee refer Report IP2022-0808 back to Administration to return to the 2022 September 9 Infrastructure and Planning Committee to consider this file from a design and environmental outcomes perspective as well as the real estate proposition presented to committee on 2022 July 7.
votes: Councillor Demong, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Mian

summary.summary_text: Report Confidential IP2022-0808. Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommend that Council hold a Public Hearing on the proposed Bylaw

titles: Proposed Land Exchange (Inglewood) – Ward 09 (4, 6, 16 New ST SE), IP2022-0812
details:
That with respect to Confidential Report IP2022-0812, the following be approved:
The Infrastructure and Planning Committee recommend that Council:


Authorize the Recommendations as outlined in Attachment 3; and
Direct that the Recommendations, Report and Attachments remain confidential pursuant to Sections 23 (Local public body confidences), 24 (Advice from officials), and 25 (Disclosure harmful to economic and other interests of a public body) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act until the transaction has been closed, except for Attachments 5 and 6 which shall remain confidential.
votes: Councillor Carra, Councillor Demong, Councillor Spencer, Councillor Mian
